reviews.text: My wife and I planned an overnight in Lancaster, PA to take our daughters ( ages 5 and 3 ) to an amusement park. The original booking was for August, but we had to re-schedule to this past weekend. When we re-booked, the suite we had in our original reservation was no longer available ( due to a wedding party )and we took a regular double room instead. The hotel is less than 10 minutes away from the strip of outlet stores and restaraunts of Lancaster as well as the dutch wonderland amusement park that we went to, so very convenient after a two hour drive from Md.
reviews.title: A conveniently located hotel with some things to work on

likes.liked: — Location and exterior appearance, views, kid playground
likes.disliked: — noisy old room and understaffed restaraunt

reviews.text: Parking and check in was smooth, but there was no door staff or attendant should you have mutliple bags or need any assistance. The room we were given was a fairly large double room facing the rear grounds of the property. There was a small play area for kids in the grassy area behind the rooms facing this side, which was a nice amenity. So, back to the room. While the hotel appears to have some sense of kid-friendliness to it based on the playgorund, the room was without a microwave or refrigerator. This seemed odd considering we saw mutliple families with small children and/or babies. The website also mentioned that there had been a recent renovation at the property, but our room had a very old style wall unit air conditioner ( that was incredibly loud ) and a toilet that flushed and gurgled by itself throughout the evening. There was some sign of a new paint job, but beyond that the furnishings and carpeting were far from new. ( this was room #103, should the hotel read this )
reviews.title: A good safe bet

reviews.text: The hotel has what I believe to be a very good restaraunt based on the menu. However, and perhaps because of the wedding party that evening, they seemed to be completely overwhelmed. I am guessing some of thier staff was working the reception, but it is just a guess. We had a good waitress and I could see that there was some frustration happening between her and the kitchen/cooking staff that evening. We waited over 45 minutes just to get our kids' orders of one hot dog and a hamburger w/fries. The entrees for my wife and I came about 15 minutes later....so now its an hour wait before eating dinner after a long day and drive. The mgmt appeared to be a 20 year old kid ( who was helping serve) and the bar tender was also pitching in taking dinner orders...and thus slacking on making the drinks orders for the wait staff. We came in just before the dinner rush and upon leaving looked into the doomed faces of the diners "waiting to wait" to eat after us. I suspect this was not a typical evening experience at their restaraunt, but based on the wait, it would have been prudent to offer something off the bill from someone in authority, but perhaps the problem was that there appeared to be no one in charge. I told my wife I would give the Netherlands another shot, but it is a good lesson that appearances can be deceiving and to not let a pretty website woo you into a mediocre experience.
reviews.title: Lovely peaceful hotel

reviews.text: This was the last stop on a six-stage tour from the UK. We were delighted to find a hotel located away from a main road. The superior room was a very good size, although the queen size beds were a little too small for our children (9 and 11) to share.
reviews.title: Poor Management of This Property !!!!!!

reviews.text: Overall we thought the hotel was excellent value, in a setting with unbeatable views across Amish farmland. Just a few points are worth noting:
reviews.title: Comfy and well priced ($99 special) for a family vacation, but could be improved

likes.liked: — Scenic location, good value, nice spa
likes.disliked: — No mini fridges in the room!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were guests at the Strasburg hotel from February 13th to
reviews.title: Super Service

likes.liked: — Close to attractions but still isolated grounds

reviews.text: the 15th. There was a snow and ice storm that caused considerable
reviews.title: Great Romantic/ Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: disruption to area attractions as well as to services at the Inn. I'm
reviews.title: Hotel needs to catch up to the Brochure and Website!

likes.liked: — The view and proximity to Strasburg RR
likes.disliked: — It's tired and rundown and in need of a renovation. The brochure is seriously false advertising!!!

reviews.title: Booker beware
reviews.text: writing to inform you of the excellent service provided by some of your

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: employees during that trying time.
reviews.title: Great view and location

reviews.text: The Netherlands Inn and Spa is located on beautiful grounds. My husband and I took our son there to see Thomas The Tank Engine at the near by railroad. Upon entering the grounds you are surrounded by beauty, HOWEVER....step into your room and you will find a smell that is horrible, spiders that look like something out of a science fiction movie, dust, dirt and the bathrooms...moldy and mildewy. The smell is awful. The most disgusting part was certainly the bathrooms and the spiders along with a massive infestation of flies. For $150 a night you would expect at least a clean room, and a spotless bathroom and beds that are cozy and comfy. The beds were like rocks, so forget about having a good nights sleep. This hotel...rather...motel is nothing like it says it is nor is it anything like what you see on the web. Just gross and we will not be staying there next year or any other time there after. Completely disgusted. Oh...and maid service...there is none. The maid comes and replaces your towels and trash bags...that's it. No making of the beds, or clean linens...no wash down of the sinks...nothing.
reviews.title: Netherlands Inn and Spa....NOT WORTH THE MONEY

likes.liked: — It's located 4 minutes from the railroad where my son could see Thomas The Tank and the grounds were stunning.
likes.disliked: — Dirty, Outdated, Uncomfortable, Pest Problem, Not Worth the Money.

reviews.text: Do not even waste your time making a reservation! We have made reservations only to be called (sometimes the week we are to arrive) to say they have overbooked and can not accommodate us. It is very frustrating to then have to make last minute reservations at another hotel. It is a nice hotel but not worth the worry that they may have overbooked. Don't waste your time making a reservation, just book somewhere else from the start. We will from now on.
reviews.title: Consistantly overbook!!

likes.disliked: — Getting kicked out more times then stayed because they had overbooked.

reviews.text: As a faith reader of Travel Advisor, I read others review of the Netherlands Inn and Spa after making reservations to take my best friend on a weekend getaway to celebrate her 40th Birthday in June. During early April, while in the area I decide to check the Inn for myself. So, I mustered up courage and walk through the doors of the Inn and was greeted by the front desk staff and by chance, the General Manager Michael Ritter. I spoke to them about my concerns and they couldn't have been nicer. Mr. Ritter showed me a few rooms and I found them both pleasant and clean, he then gave me his card and asked me to call him to let him know when we were arriving. We just returned 6/3/07 from 3 wonderful nights! The grounds were lovely with brick walks and manicured lawns, the rooms where tastefully decorated. Every one we encountered from the front desk to the the breakfast wait staff were very friendly and gracious. Spa Orange was very relaxing and we both enjoyed a wonderful massage by Kat and Lark. The Netherlands Inn and Spa is truly a grand old lady. I would not hesitate recommending the Netherlands Inn and Spa to anyone looking for a place to unwind and relax.
reviews.title: Lovely, Wonderful and so on!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted to celebrate our wedding anniversary but could not get away for more than overnight. We agreed to the area of Lancaster, PA but didn’t know where.
reviews.title: Serenity at the Netherlands Inn

likes.disliked: — No interior halls, but is that bad?

reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful Time...A Must See...
reviews.text: I was hoping for something convenient and clean. I found the Netherlands Inn online and it was more than just a “find”.

While attending Sight & Sound, we booked several rooms for family members & friends for a weekend at the Netherlands. What a wonderful surprise! The visit was very pleasant from the time we checked in until we checked out (we added a day on to our stay due to the accomodations and the friendly atmosphere). We have already starting planning a 2008 Family reunion -this time I am going to take advantage of the spa!
reviews.title: Planning a family reunion at this wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a property that has great potential, but isn't quite "there" yet. The grounds were even prettier than I expected, lovely plantings everywhere, and very well maintained. We enjoyed sitting on the chairs outside and taking in the view of the farmland in the distance and admiring the pretty setting. I wish I could say that about the rest of the property. We had booked a King Deluxe room for two nights, which was advertised on their website as being remodeled and updated, with a separate sink area, etc. Instead, we were given a room that was totally outdated, like something from the 60's or 70's. The worst part about it was the old A/C unit. It was loud, and got even louder as the night went on, which meant we didn't get much sleep. We were given the room we should have had the next night, and it was much, much better . . . as advertised, remodeled/updated, bigger, and a quiet A/C unit, but only after much confusion about whether our new room was ready - it was after 3:00. No offer of compensation was offered, either. Another guest was complaining about the dangerously hot water which was hard to control (we had that in the original room -in both the sink and shower), and he actually burned his foot from it. He complained that they didn't adjust his bill to comensate him for it. The breakfast was good, but it was so disorganized and so loud, with dishes clanging. . . people were walking in with no one to greet them, not realizing they could go ahead and seat themselves, and waiting around, then looking to find someone in charge. The pool was small, but nice, but the spa tub was definitely not clean, (murky water) so we didn't even think about getting in. Also, they let the used pool towels pile up and overflow. It was a pleasant surprise to see two hot air balloons overhead while we were lounging at the pool. By the way, we did hear the desk clerk tell another guest that they were still in the process of updating the rooms. I would suggest that you contact the hotel directly to make reservations, and to specifically request an updated room, or I think you will be disappointed, and may lose a night's sleep. Maybe once they improve the rest of the rooms and become a little more organized, it will be the kind of place it really should be. Our experience could have been wonderful with a few improvements.
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Setting!

likes.disliked: — Terrible room that was not renovated, as advertised

reviews.title: Do not believe the website
reviews.text: By looking at the website, we were anticipating a lovely, sophisticated and tranquil country retreat. In defense of the Netherlands Inn and Spa, many of the hotels that we saw and drove by in the area looked a bit rundown and sad, but this place was simply awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room appeared to have just barely been cleaned and the upholstery was stained in many places and dingy. The room had the feeling, look, furnishings and smell of a college dorm room. The coup de grace was a 1/2 used old bar of soap in the bathtub.
reviews.title: Would return again!

likes.disliked: — Older plumbing effected shower pressure and temperature at peak times

reviews.text: The pool is small, crowded and on the 2 days we were there filled with screaming children. Not the hotel's fault, of course, but anyone looking for a relaxing, adult getaway should know that this is not the place. The chairs on the lawn seemed to be the only outdoor space on the property with a measure of tranquility, but they were dirty and covered in bird droppings.
reviews.title: Lancaster county's best kept secret!!! Can't wait to visit again!!!!!
